mapper.insert:
select order_sheet_seq.nextval from dual
insert into order_sheet values(#{no}, #{member_no}, #{client_no}, sysdate, #{out_day}, 0)
mapper.select: select m.no, m.name member_name, c.name client_name, m.day, m.out_day, m.status from(select o.no, m.name, o.client_no, o.day, o.out_day, o.status from order_sheet o inner join member m on o.member_no = m.no) m inner join client c on m.client_no = c.no order by no desc

select * from( select m.no, m.name member_name, c.name client_name, m.day, m.out_day, m.status from(select o.no, m.name, o.client_no, o.day, o.out_day, o.status from order_sheet o inner join member m on o.member_no = m.no) m inner join client c on m.client_no = c.no ) where no > 0
and member_name like '%' || #{keyword} || '%' and client_name like '%' || #{keyword} || '%'
and no in
#{arr}
order by no desc offset #{beginRow} rows fetch next #{pageSize} rows only

select distinct(order_no) from(select od.no, od.order_no, od.amount, it.code item_code, it.name item_name, it.in_price, it.out_price from order_detail od inner join item it on od.item_no = it.no) where item_name like '%' || #{keyword} || '%'

select no, day, out_day, status, member_no, member_name, dep_no, dep_code, dep_name, client_no, client_code, client_name, rank_no, rank_code, rank_name from( select o.no, to_char(to_date(o.day), 'yyyy-MM-dd') day, to_char(to_date(o.out_day), 'yyyy-MM-dd') out_day, o.status, m.no member_no, m.name member_name, d.no dep_no, d.code dep_code, d.name dep_name, c.no client_no, c.code client_code, c.name client_name, r.no rank_no, r.code rank_code, r.name rank_name from order_sheet o inner join member m on o.member_no = m.no inner join client c on o.client_no = c.no inner join department d on m.dep_no = d.no inner join rank r on m.rank_no = r.no) where no=#{no}
mapper.update: update ORDER_SHEET set status = 1 where no = #{order_no} and status = 0
